Articles.Content: Lol xd.

IN THE GODDAMNED LHS 3447 SYSTEM!!!

(No wonder I couldn't find him)

Stuck on the Mun! He'll have to wait there until i can afford a rescue ship...

Edited February 17, 2016 by Oxygen Thief
He's dead.
Stuck on Laythe Colony 1 (without a return stage)

Piloting my tourist ships as I get up funds to maybe do something like mining or launch one of my solar science stations into a kerbin orbit to get science and maybe get home afterwards, though they would probably tumble during reentry and lawn-dart to their deaths... gonna need more scientists for them. getting the same problem as my science save of having tons of engineers and pilots but few scientists. they're probably all in a solar orbit...
Jeb died off camera while I was landing on minmus. He was flying the shuttle back from the Mun base and I warped him into kerbin. I only fly one craft at a time out of orbit now.

My Jebediah Kerman is currently orbiting Duna with Bill and Bob in a Duna exploration ship that ran out of fuel. I tried sending a rescue mission but it also ran out of fuel. Maybe I should redesign my Duna launcher...
He recently repurposed the Mobile Minmus Orbiting Lab into a Duna VASIMR-ship. A one way Duna VASIMR-ship.
Long story short, dead in an F-4 cockpit
Dead.

He's in the Astronaut Complex awaiting his next mission. He's in close competition with Valentina for most missions completed safely.

Really, the only time I have problems is when I have a glitch, or accidentally select a landing site on the Mun or other "heavy" gravity celestial body that is heavily sloped.

Jeb is my Senior Training Captain and lead test pilot. He flies all the new stuff on Mun-runs, including new Kerbals.

He's currently at KSC after returning from the launch of the Meteor I survey satellite.
MunBase 1 waiting to return after 4 years and 137 days.
Dead.

he died quite awhile ago, and so did another. But I was too far into my science mode to begin the game all over again just to get Jeb back. I miss him a great deal, and I'd love it if someone had a supernatural way of reviving him, but I must just press on with the others happily making out in the crew headquarters. This was before I knew how to use the Tracking Station to cancel the mission.
On a suborbital trajectory. At Eve. In an orbital space station.  Aerobraking is hard.
After being stuck on Duna for a decade or so, he returned to Kerbin and is now happily testing spaceplanes. He'll probably head to Dres soon though.

He's currently aboard a crew transfer vehicle docked at mun station, waiting for enough fuel to head for minmus (okay he's waiting for bill to send up some fuel...from the resource mining base...using kis...waiting for the cargo ship with the attachment parts...
Dead. I don't even know how he died, he just... Stopped existing, which is weird because all my flights have been made with Val.
He's waiting for the engineers to finish building the core for the minmus outpost and trying to convince them to build a manned sky crane that he can play with.
At KSC recovering after a tourist Munshot went horribly wrong.

I've sent Jeb on exploratory missions to the Mun and Minmus, but really Val is the explorer of my astronaut corps with extensive surface survey experience. Jeb is my blue-collar hauler spaceplane pilot, shuttling crews and satellites into LKO.

Not yesterday, though. He assumed test pilot duties for my first interplanetary vessel (for this playthrough).

Edited December 18, 2015 by DunaRocketeer
Dead. Current aerodynamics makes beginning of first two pilot's career extremely dangerous. Fortunately Valentina still lives.
Oh... He's, uhh, dea- On a marvelous vacation! On the Mun! Burned up... Seven feet underground...
